sub_title: Lead CX/UX Designer | Lean UX, Expert Solutions, Product & Service Innovation | Finance, Risk & Regulatory (FRR)
summary:
- Laser-focused on defining, advising on, designing, delivering (valuable) digital tools and services that enable businesses to grow sustainably and responsibly. 
- Proficient in design, MarCom, senior exec, 'tech' & academia speak. 
- Opinions are welcome, but let's look at the data before making decisions.
- Will put customer (needs) front & centre. 
- And then will put the well-being/growth of teams working to meet those even more to the front.
- Will think big, start small, act fast.

Keywords: CX/UX Design, Service Design, Design thinking, Lean UX, Lean Product, Design Operations, Business of Design, Complex Entreprise Application Design, L&D, Communication Design,  Information Science, Information Systems; 

Industries: B2B, Financial services, RegTech, LegalTech, FinTech, Policy, R&D, Learning & Development, Consulting, Professional sports;

school.name: Colegiul National de Arte Regina Maria

courses.name: Ethics and Politics of Surveillance and Privacy

profile_positions.location: Alphen aan Den Rijn, South Holland, Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Lead CX/UX Designer

profile_positions.description:
Studio Panā is a design practice focusing (mainly) on B2B and expert/professional services providers. It operates by filling in the knowledge-skills gap and bringing in missing specialist design expertise into organisations - in areas like:

* Design strategy
* Branding & communication design
* UX/Service design
* Information science & human-centred interaction (HCI) 


Example projects include:

* (re)branding and platform redesign (UX/Information) of a full-service legal practice, branding & design strategy for the first ever Tier 1 European Bitcoin ETF
* Co-creation session design & facilitation on future of housing for Dutch municipalities
* Design, digital & comms strategy for a Smart Cities EU initiative
* Design, development & research of a digital society monitor for a large Dutch knowledge institute.
profile_positions.title: Founder
Design & Tech Lead / Instruments Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Working on the digital transformation side of DSS:

* Led the design and delivery of digital tools and services for our external partners - from strategy to implementation. Among them: legal expert systems, conversational agents, various dashboards, MOOCs & educational tools, method toolkits. 
* Acted as product owner for internal digital tools & services stack as well as for multi-year customer project tracks.
* Brand awareness, thought leadership, interviews, conference talks & panels within the DSS ecosystem.
* Created and gave courses  related topics to both professionals and trainees/students.
profile_positions.title: UX/Service Designer - Partner instruments
UX/UI/Service Designer - LMS & internal instruments

profile_positions.description:
CORE Raise & Retain was founded on the conviction that AMs can benefit immensely from a more human-centered approach to raising and retaining investments. Through our integrated strategy, we help Asset Managers raise more capital in the short term, and retain investors for the long term.  Combined, our clients manage a total of $20+ tn in assets globally across 15+ countries.

- Handled the design & HCD  aspects of communication,sales enablement products, services & strategies we provide to large retail & institutional clients, for a variety of portfolio types, asset classes, instruments & strategies. 
- Delivered brand strategies, designs & docs for smaller asset managers & new names in the ESG, Crypto & DeFi space.
- Supervised, coached, guided designers in our Bangalore hub and more junior analysts in Amsterdam HQ.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Designer

profile_positions.description:
MobPro is the mobile advertising agency that helps top brands to engage consumers with their brand story through smartphone, the right way. Every day, thirty mobile professionals work on mobile advertising campaigns, app marketing and conversational advertising solutions. MobPro does this based on years of mobile experience and a clear vision on technological developments, so brands can grow: now and in the future.​

24AM is the mobile-first creatieve agency that develops brand stories to attract nowadays consumers. Since the smartphone is people’s first go-to device, we start making strategies and concepts from this point of view. Then 24AM translates a brand’s story into efficacious creatives that suits every digital device in order to grow brand performance.

- Creative design, visual design, interaction design, motion design for various advertising campaigns - multiple channels, formats etc. programmatic, display, OOH, social, TV, conversational, microsite.
- Concept development, creative strategy various advertising campaigns

Industries: News/Entertainment, Insurance, Food & beverages, Music/Entertainment, Radio, Travel, Furniture, Gaming
profile_positions.title: Digital Designer & Creative Developer

profile_positions.description:
MoneyLab is a network of artists and geeks experimenting with forms of financial democratization. It is part of the Institute of Network Cultures (INC) in Amsterdam, which is focused on analyzing and shaping the terrain of network cultures through events, publications, and online dialogue. INC projects evolve around digital publishing, alternative revenue models, online video and design, digital counter culture and much more.

While an intern at the MoneyLab in Amsterdam I've worked on several aspects of design & communication. My roles & responsibilites included:

- For MoneyLab Reader #2 Crowdfunding Campaign: Communication Design, Concept and Strategy - and actually running & managing the campaign.  
- We exceeded our target by 20% and was invited to give lecture to students at AMFI after about it.
- For the MoneyLab Event at Pakhuys de Zwijger: Event design and organisation of the event - various artefacts.
profile_positions.title: Communication Designer

company.name: Centre of Expertise for Creative Innovation

profile_positions.company: Centre of Expertise for Creative Innovation (CoECI)
profile_positions.description:
The PublishingLab, part of CoECI (formerly known as ACIN) conducts applied research by doing innovative experiments in the field of (digital) publishing. This can be research on the impact of developments on the branch as a whole, conducting small experiments in the field of EPUB3 such as research/work on user interfaces for collaborative online editing environments, research/work on conveying hybrid publishing concepts and workflows to a non-expert audience or looking into interesting design problems to tackle.

The work I've done as an intern at the PublishingLab involved Design Research, Speculative Design, Critical Design, Concept Development, Interface (physical & digital) and Communication Design for the project "Alternative Revenue Models for E-Publishing".
profile_positions.title: Design Researcher

profile_positions.description:
The lectoraat (UK: Readership, US: Professorship) in Strategic Creativity explores how design and creativity can play a strategic role in society and the economy in general, and in service innovation in particular. This is done with a 'thinking through making' approach where design and reflection go hand in hand.

From 2011-2015, the Readership was a proud partner in CRISP, a Dutch national research programme in which Design Academy Eindhoven co-operated with the Technical Universities of Delft, Eindhoven and Twente, both Universities of Amsterdam and 60 companies and organisations in the creative & service industries.
 
As a Student Research Assistant for CRISP, I worked on the Communication Design, Promotion & Event Planning for CRISP Design Research Symposium.
profile_positions.title: Student Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Active Training develops, organizes and delivers programs of experiential learning for individuals and teams from the corporate field (team-building, corporate events). Their goal is to motivate participants and clients’ teams to re-discover their values and motivations through working together!

For Active Training, I developed and conducted a series of Workshops on Sustainable Design.
profile_positions.title: Workshop Designer

volunteer_experiences.description:
Volt is a pan-European, progressive movement that is bringing a grassroots and truly inclusive approach to politics in the European Union! A citizens-centric movement, committed to bringing forth real change for the betterment of all European societies, its citizens and residents. As a transnational movement, we believe we can help the European people unite, create a shared vision and understanding, exchange good practices across the continent, and come up with policies together.

A new way of doing politics, for a new millennium.

I am a member of the following teams: Dutch Communications Team, Dutch Graphics Team, Amsterdam Local Team. In these teams, I work and consult on design & communication strategy, visual/graphic design, promotion of the Volt Mission, Vision ,Values and Policies.

Eindhoven strives to be the Design Capital of Europe. These ambitions make sense, with a flourishing design network, impressive design and art galleries, a smart and creative region and of course the world famous Dutch Design Week. A Design Capital needs a platform to discuss, feed the design climate, to cross boundaries with other disciplines and of course connect all players (and players-to-be) within the field. Therefore Eindhoven-based cultural and educational institutions Design Academy Eindhoven, MU, The New Institute, Capital D founded the Design Debates platform. The platform is supported by critical friends: Baltan Laboratories, Alice, Capital D. Every month Design Debates Eindhoven will host an afternoon debate at the Designhuis in Eindhoven.

While volunteering for the Design Debates, my roles included Research & Development for Debates, Yearly Debate Programme, Communication Design & Social Media Communication & Design.

EMMA Radio is an Eindhoven based Podcast Channel part of Design Academy Eindhoven. It produces talks, debates, interviews, reportages and interventions on Design, Society, Culture and important events within de Design sphere such as Dutch Design Week and Salone del Mobile Milano. 

As a member of EMMA Radio, I've participated in/worked on developing the programs for Dutch Design Week, conducting interviews, reporting, editing podcasts and narrating/presenting shows, as well as designing promotional material for the channel.

Mare Nostrum is a non-profit, apolitical and independent ecological association in Constanta, founded in 1993 at the initiative of young specialists from various fields related to marine research and environmental protection, who realized that science alone can not solve the serious ecological imbalances in the Black Sea region. Mare Nostrum is an organization open to all citizens concerned with the degradation of the Romanian seaside environment, whose mission is to change the current practices and attitudes of local communities, decision-makers and other interest groups with those that ensure the conservation and rational use of resources natural in the Romanian coastal area. Focusing on partnership and respect for the environment, Mare Nostrum works in the direction of public awareness, ecological education and puts pressure on the decision makers, for the effective protection of the Black Sea environment and the Romanian coastal zone.

My roles as a volunteer for Mare Nostrum included Monitoring beaches of Constanta (Romania) and Mamaia (Romania), reporting on areas in need of significant waste disposal and monitoring sea life on coastline.

Asociatia din Pod has gained notoriety in Bucharest but also in the country through the impact of its art projects aimed at the Bucharest public space and community. They collaborate with public institutions such as Bucharest City Hall, ArCub, Bucharest Market Administration, ALPAB, Alfred Rusescu Institute of Mother and Child, University of Bucharest, Ion Mincu University of Architecture, Metrorex, Romanian Peasant Museum, National Museum of Geology, "Grigore Antipa", Natural History Museum, Bucharest Museum, National Library, History Museum, Constanta City Hall and many other NGOs and private companies.

Four years in a row (2010, 2011, 2012, 2013) the program was one of the winners of the National Cultural Fund Administration through the projects: The Adventures of MR Urban and Anima Sana.

For the project The Adventures of MR Urban La Mare, as a public intervention, I participated in the repurposing and restoration of a 300m boundary wall at Tataia Beach (Constanta, Romania).
